title: lowercase silent hell of cheryl based on what sans serif originally?
tags: font ID identification typeface sans serif
content:
A designer used silent hell of cheryl's lowercase font  
found here:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/silent-hill.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014165721/http:/www.dafont.com/silent-hill.font "http://www.dafont.com/silent-hill.font")

SLNTHLC.TTF

to create her logo. She stretched and manipulated it, but I'd like the figure out what this "grundge" font  
is based off of. The original sans serif version before it had the degraded effect.

I have attached a sample.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 22.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014165721/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2022_4.png) | 29.03 KB |
author: mjhalo

comments.content: Oh wow, of course. Thanks so much.
